title: France v Ireland: Women’s Rugby World Cup 2025 quarter-final – live
summary: Daniel Gallan provides a live update on the third quarter-final match taking place at Exeter's Sandy Park. Fans can expect minute-by-minute coverage of the game's developments. Stay tuned for key moments and highlights as the match progresses.

title: Burnley v Liverpool: Premier League – live
summary: Liverpool aims to extend their winning streak in an upcoming match against Burnley at Turf Moor. John Brewin will provide a real-time report of the game. Fans can follow along for minute-by-minute updates.

title: World Athletics Championships 2025: Jefferson-Wooden and Seville blast to 100m golds – live
summary: Daniel Harris reports live from Tokyo, providing updates on a bustling evening filled with medal competitions. Athletes are vying for honors as the excitement unfolds. Stay tuned for all the highlights and results.

title: Will Still and John Mousinho face off as Southampton and Portsmouth draw
summary: The long-awaited league match between Southampton and Portsmouth, their first in over 13 years, ended in a tense 0-0 draw. The game was marked by numerous fouls, resulting in multiple yellow cards. Despite the lack of goals, the rivalry proved intense on the pitch.

title: Scale of ‘Unite the Kingdom’ march shows free speech ‘alive and well’ in UK, says minister – UK politics live
summary: Peter Kyle expressed that he was not troubled by the large far-right protest organized by Tommy Robinson. However, he condemned any violence targeted at the police during the event. His comments highlight a stance against both extremism and aggression towards law enforcement.
